intro: Icacorea platyphylla, commonly known as the flatleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often found in shrublands and is a member of the Malvaceae family. Icacorea platyphylla is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
